especially in person or over the phone are contentious so I have asked to stop and move to this platform.

From:Christine Moyer

Happy Birthday
Plans for today as I understand.
You will pick up Adrian and Dylan after school.
Dylan to be dropped off at his house.
Adrian to spend the day/evening with you.
TBD if Adrian spends the night.
Ski ride program emailed me yesterday and thought they could accommodate the switch to Sunday but wanted more details on his age etc. If they
confirm today, plan is for Adrian to spend the night and I pick up at 9am on Saturday.
If I do not receive a confirmation on the switch, I will pick up Adrian at 8:30pm tonight so he can attend ski lesson Saturday am.

Sent:01/05/2024 at 04:53 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 01/06/2024 at 08:14 AM)
Subject:Re: Adrian today
Message 243 of 4024
It was probably one of the best ever, tbh. Really an awesome day. AD is just amazing. And I really love coaching his team. I’m in my element. For that
matter, I’ve turned a corner I think. I look great, feel great, and we have a parenting plan so all my big problems are solved.
That said, I did miss your voice on this special day for the first time in 29 years. Even when we talked late at night from River Oaks Parkway to
Seymour Road. There will be a lot of firsts in our ending. That’s fine. But tbh, I still love some part of you. I don’t feel bad about it either.
And you say I don’t have that kind of access to you, so that is fine. But when I pledged to love you till death do us part, I meant it. And I still do. And
even though you hate everything about me, I know in my heart I never held malice for you. I learned wrong. Not an excuse, a reality.
I’m not asking you for anything. And I’m entitled to my own feelings and my own reality. It’s me that we
are talking about after all. And I know more about the how, why, and intent of my actions than anyone, even you. So I’m ok telling you I know my
truth. And we can both be right.
Hope when things get better I can have a rain check on my bday dinner. It would be nice to break bread with an old friend who I shared so many of
these days with in the past. Till then, I’ll do my best with this new opportunity and move the hell on with my life. Unexplained as it is.

From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 01/06/2024 at 08:14 AM)
Subject:My Birthday

You are sending me blackmailing texts.
You signed a lease yesterday for 6.800 without consultation and communicated it’s all community property and within your rights to commit me to a
spend for my half without my input.
Threatening me that you will make unilateral decisions because I will not respond to your blackmail threatening texts is your choice.
I do not plan to respond to any more emails, texts, calls or this platform as I feel threatened.

And I am not escalating. I am also not addressing what you are saying below. I don’t believe that to be true but you’re free to say what you want.
Do you want to be involved in the term of the lease decision or not?

Ok... fyi I was able to talk him into 9 months with month to month after. I’d like 12, I’m so tired
of moving. But want to be sensitive to the churn at play. I’m assuming that is what you would like.
I’m really trying, Christine, I’m just done waiting. On a place to live, getting my stuff, getting a parenting plan for our kids. everything that allows me
to move on. Everywhere you’re blocking me from doing it.
And while I sympathize that you ALWAYS say you have no time, but make time for new relationships while your kids don’t even know about the
divorce and I’m totally blocked, my sympathy runs thin.
You have made zero effort for the kids therapy, or the the work we are supposed to be doing. It’s awesome you’re putting yourself first, but please
start making some time to clean up the wreckage you are creating.
Forget about me. You hate me.
Think about the freaking kids.

Subject:Adrian today
Message 264 of 4024
ACK on AD, thank you. I’ll do my best and communicate with him.
I have LUGGs lined up for this week Mon-Wed to start uncoupling. My plan is to move consistent with our shared email.
There may still some fine tuning (example: I think Max uses the stair master to train)  but I’ll stick to the confirmed items. It will likely be a couple of
weeks to complete but it’s a start.
I hope that you are pleased I negotiated a 9 month lease. Very few places will do that but I made it clear that was the reason this place was even in
consideration.
So while it may bother you, I am tried my best and it’s a competitive rent in this market. And it’s near you, a SAAS bustop, and the kids should
approve of the space.
I’d also like to make some purchase descriptions today. (Example: ScanPan, Linens, Towels, organizing stuff- Kitchen and closet, etc...) I think we
agreed for some of these we both need a refresh. In other cases we can either split, or purchase new and have two separate sets. I am happy and would
prefer collaboration.
I am trying to work constructively with you to extricate myself from any area of your life that is not necessary. Every cross word about who is doing
what on a Eastside place is likely washed breath. It will be resolved by someone else in the future. So let’s just start trying to work together in a positive
way with a shared goal.
Please do reply. It’s so hard to communicate sometimes and you have called it out as well. I’m not debating the platforms right now. I’m talking about
this message and this topic on OFW.
Thanks

but it’s your 50/50 later”. But that is earmarked as a spend.
I don’t think either of us would do that without knowing if the next 20 years we are both living in  separate but duplicate lives in our own 1.3k square
foot apartment. But we may. This is tough for sure.

Subject:Just Now
Message 279 of 4024
<<I sent this to you in October. It is my understanding of the current situation. But I’m not a lawyer. It was also a plea to work together so we made
smart fiscal decisions for the long term. My offer still stands>>
Hey-
I was thinking about what you said about us drawing down your assets since you make more money than I do now even though we continue to pull
from Fidelity the same way we always did to cover the gaps.
Hypothetically Speaking:
- Let's say I made 5x what you made over 24 years (it was definitely more, given the stock market returns we have seen)
- In the last year, we got my full 10-month payout, one month of vacation, and now unemployment checks. No bonus or stock.
As I understand in community property states, any income earned by either spouse during the marriage and all property bought with those earnings is
considered community property, owned equally by both spouses. Likewise, our debts incurred during our marriage are shared debts. So while I was
the primary breadwinner for 24 years and am now unemployed and drawing benefits that are a fraction of your income, the wealth accumulated
during the years when I was the primary earner is considered joint property, regardless of who earned more. So when it comes time for us to divide
assets, the law would look for a fair distribution that considers the entire marriage span, not just the current earning situation. So that's the 24 years I
was the primary breadwinner as well as the last few months you were.
But what I heard you say is you think you are paying all the bills now because you are the primary earner while we draw from our shared investments
(which are 1/2 yours). So, given the status quo, how do you think that you are disproportionately contributing to our marital assets? I can understand
your perception from an emotional standpoint, but I don't think it aligns with the legal view of community property. Just like I can't say I was paying
for everything for the previous 24 years. It might feel unfair given our recent shift in financial dynamics, but I don't get how it's different with you as
the main breadwinner, even if the change in our roles feels abrupt or unbalanced. I feel like we just swapped roles for the last couple of months
(though I don't think you make 4-8x what I did given my payout and unemployment benefits)
You worked to make us an effective team, and we could not have accumulated our nest egg without your contributions to our household. Those let
Sent:01/07/2024 at 06:17 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 01/07/2024 at 06:32 PM)
Subject:You demanded I “Get a Job” and left....

me focus on a high-paying job and make great investment choices in the market and real estate. But in a community asset state, the 50/50 model
doesn't change even when our roles are reversed. So your current earnings, my payout, and my unemployment benefits are just part of our marital
estate. So if we are currently drawing from our joint income and investments to pay our bills, why would it be viewed as drawing solely from your
earnings? Till we divvy everything up, everything is still the same, right? It's just you have been contributing more these last few months. The same
way I did for the last 24 years is the way that I interpret what is going on now.
Definitely not trying to argue. It's just how I interpret community property until we go our own way after the divorce. And as I mentioned today, I
really hope we learn to be civil enough to effectively partner with financial professionals to make the best long-term decisions as a team (we both have
a good head on our shoulders). Especially when it comes to things like "when to sell what" wrt stock to pay the least amount of taxes as our brackets
evolve and change. Of course, the same goes for the house and condo sale. Given the interest rate hell we are going to be dealing with, essentially
forgoing all that we tried to do, we may not be able to reasonably buy homes for years to come. Divorces are utterly devastating to retirement plans
along with future quality of life, given the self-inflicted opportunity costs.
Let's get our animosity in order and put our thinking caps on!!!!

this soon.
thanks!

Message 326 of 4024
<< Please wait till you can take a moment and really read this. I know I send you a lot of emails, but this is actually meaningful >>
Today you said something critically important to closing out our relationship in a more timely way with less acrimony, possibly setting us up to teach
the kids something valuable as a life skill.
The “two things can be right” recap:

choice.

what you asked.
It was an impossible dilemma. A catch 22. There are nuances and blame we both would like to disproportionally heap on each other because of the
awful situation. And neither of us wants to bear the burden of blowing up our family.
But I have no desire to fight about that. We are not in a safe enough space to play with that fire yet. In good time after some healing apart we can
consider it.
But today you said “I want to tell you something I have never told you before, I endured this for twice as long as you and I have never even had a
moment to process”... and it made me think- this is so much more than just me involved.
I have always made the assumption you were full steam ahead. Happy about it all and loving your decision. No concerns, you won the lottery with
that July 5th call- No more Big. And tbh I don’t see the collateral damage weighing on you in the least.
So what? Here’s what- the last six months have been sheer unadulterated hell. We have compounded our problem 10x fold. And we created our own
ever worsening self fulfilling prophecy of literal doom. And we are spiraling out of control.
We can’t turn back time. Too much blood has been shed to forget. But, we still control our future. And we know now so much left unsaid has done
so much damage, that we should consider doing something different moving forward.
In your moment of transparency and honesty I honestly understood where you were coming from. I get it. Finally a window into the black box of
inexplicable despair that I needed desperately to understand. I even think we have a lot in common.
These moments, these hard, honest truths, if we open up, like we have not before, will allow us to be relatable and show vulnerability to each others
perspective. We don’t have to be right, we just have to make an effort to understand each other.
Sent:01/08/2024 at 10:00 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 01/09/2024 at 07:53 AM)
Subject:Please Consider in a Quiet Moment

But to this point we have each dug in hard. There is only one POV, it’s mine, and it’s right! But that never really works. And it has proven to be even
more destructive than the original sin that got us into this place. We are repeating the pattern.
But I hope, that the two people who raised three kids and dreamed of forever can find the time to start communicating again. Perhaps show some
humanity for each other. And agree this was not on purpose. Blaming each other will never help us.
We had our reasons for making the decisions we did. But we see now that they were driven by bad data and incorrect assumptions. We stopped
communicating and got it all wrong.
I’ve made my point. And because I’m learning, and trying to get better now that I know, I am not asking for anything. I just wanted to share my
perspective.
It is my hope however that after 30 years of doing a bad job on both sides of being honest and compassionate, that we consider creating a safe place.
One that helps us understand how we got here, in the hope we never do it again.
You are our cycle breaker. The hero! We have a plan now to course correct- every problem we had but this one. Lets not throw it away or minimize
this. Let’s take advantage of your bravery. Let’s put something positive together that leaves us with a legacy we can both be proud of and we take
forward as a win.
Let’s start with compassion for what the other is feeling and not start by blaming, let’s communicate honestly with each other again,  let’s give each
other the space to heal separately without constructing a wall. And in good time let’s find a safe space and setting to compare notes and start to heal.
